title: How to Make Gel Air Freshener

steps.headline: Bring 1 cup of distilled water to a boil.
Add 4 packages of unflavored gelatin and stir until dissolved.
Remove the mixture from the heat.
Stir in the other cup of water.
Add 10-20 drops of essential oil or other concentrated fragrance.
Add food coloring to tint your gel if you like.
Add a mold inhibitor, such as  salt, a small amount of potassium sorbate or a splash of vodka.
Pour the gel into clean baby food jars or other small containers.
steps.description: You can decorate the containers if you want.

steps.headline: Place the air fresheners in the refrigerator for a quick set (and scented fridge).

text: Bring 1 cup of distilled water to a boil.  Add 4 packages of unflavored gelatin and stir until dissolved.  Remove the mixture from the heat.  Stir in the other cup of water.  Add 10-20 drops of essential oil or other concentrated fragrance.  Add food coloring to tint your gel if you like.  Add a mold inhibitor, such as  salt, a small amount of potassium sorbate or a splash of vodka.  Pour the gel into clean baby food jars or other small containers. You can decorate the containers if you want. Place the air fresheners in the refrigerator for a quick set (and scented fridge).  Finished.
sentences: Bring 1 cup of distilled water to a boil.
Add 4 packages of unflavored gelatin and stir until dissolved.
Remove the mixture from the heat.
Stir in the other cup of water.
Add 10-20 drops of essential oil or other concentrated fragrance.
Add food coloring to tint your gel if you like.
Add a mold inhibitor, such as  salt, a small amount of potassium sorbate or a splash of vodka.
Pour the gel into clean baby food jars or other small containers.
You can decorate the containers if you want.
Place the air fresheners in the refrigerator for a quick set (and scented fridge).
